page.title: 13NORTHEY ISLAND
page.content: Northey Island is East of Maldon, down the river towards where the river meets the sea.It used to be private land used for farming but a few years ago it was bought by the Essex Natura- lists Trust and in 1984 was bought by the National Trust.There is still a farm on the island but much of the land is marsh.The only way to get to Northey Island is across the narrow causeway,which is only possible when the tide is out.It is a good place for wild flowers and birds.There are some special hides which have been built so that you can watch the birds without disturbing them.You have to get a spe- cial permit before you can go on the island.The most famous birds that vis- it Northey Island are the Brent Geese which fly over from Siberia and spend the Winter here every year.
